SENT.plain: Diabetes ketoacidosis (DKA) is one of the common complications of type I insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus
Neurological deterioration during an episode of DKA is usually assumed to be caused by cerebral edema and cerebral vascular accidents
However, hemorrhagic stroke is a very rare complication of juvenile DKA
We describe a girl who had newly diagnosed insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus with juvenile DKA developed intracerebral hemorrhage
